teams = list(map(int, input().split()))

teams.sort()
print(sum(teams[0::2]) - sum(teams[1::2]))
#!/usr/bin/env python3



def main():
    n = int(input())
    times = [int(x) for x in input().split()]

    times.sort()

    total = 0
    for i in range(n):
        total += (n - i) * times[i]

    print(total)


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

n = int(input())
teams = [int(x) for x in input().split()]
teams = sorted(teams)

total_time = 0

for i in range(n):
    total_time += teams[i] * (n - i)

print(total_time)

# Solution

# Number of teams
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement an algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times
T.sort()

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

# Solution

# Number of teams
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement an algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times.
# This is a stable sort.
T.sort(reverse=True)

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even.
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd.
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

print(sum(times))

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()]
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# the second shortest time should go second, etc.
# and the longest time should go last

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()]  # list comprehension
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

# Solution for https://atcoder.jp/contests/abc079/tasks/abc079_c

# Number of teams
N = int(input())
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement an algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times
T.sort()

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

N = int(input())
times = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sort the times in descending order
times.sort(reverse=True)

# Greedy algorithm
# The one with the shortest time should go first
# the second shortest time should go second, etc.
# and the longest time should go last (this is the only time it will be waiting,
# so it doesn't matter)

# The time it takes to finish all lectures is the sum of the times
print(sum(times))

    times = [int(x) for x in input().split()]

    times.sort()

    total = 0
    for i in range(n):
        total += (n - i) * times[i]

    print(total)

def get_min_time(n, times):
    times.sort()

    total = 0
    for i in range(n):
        total += (n - i) * times[i]

    return total


def main():
    n = int(input())
    times = [int(x) for x in input().split()]

    print(get_min_time(n, times))


if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = [int(x) for x in sys.stdin.readline().split()]
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

# Number of teams
N = int(input())  # input N
# Time required for the i-th team to understand and implement an algorithm
T = list(map(int, input().split()))

# Sorted times
T.sort()

total_time = 0

# When the number of teams is even
if N % 2 == 0:
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

# When the number of teams is odd
else:
    for i in range(1, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]
    for i in range(0, N, 2):
        total_time += T[i]

print(total_time)

import sys

def main():
    n = int(sys.stdin.readline())
    times = list(map(int, sys.stdin.readline().split()))
    times.sort()

    a = 0
    b = 0
    for i in range(n):
        if i % 2 == 0:
            a += times[i]
        else:
            b += times[i]

    print(max(a, b))

if __name__ == '__main__':
    main()
